info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-vrrp-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG
     definitions for VRRP operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2017-2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Network Services
**Paths:** 5

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-vrrp-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-vrrp-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-vrrp-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-vrrp-oper.html)

if-number.description: IfIndex for the interface on which VRRP group is hosted

addr-type.description: Address family of VRRP group. IPv4 or IPv6 are the two valid values

virtual-ip.description: Primary Virtual IP address for the VRRP group

if-name.description: Name for the interface on which VRRP group is hosted

virtual-mac.description: Virtual MAC address for the VRRP group

master-ip.description: IP address of the Master router for the VRRP group

is-owner.description: Whether the router owns the VRRP Primary virtual IP address. When Interface IP address and VRRP Primary virtual IP address are the same for this router, its priority is bumped up to 255

priority.description: Specifies the priority value used for VRRP master election process. Valid values are 0 to 255. 0 is used by a current master router to gracefully retire from the vrrp group. 255 indicates the master router also owns the VRRP virtual IP address

advertisement-timer.description: Time interval between hello packets sent by the master router in milliseconds

master-down-timer.description: Time after which a backup router declares the current master to be down in milliseconds

skew-time.description: Time to skew Master Down Interval in milliseconds

preempt.description: Controls whether a higher priority virtual router will preempt a lower priority master

master-transitions.description: Number of master transitions that have happened in the VRRP group

new-master-reason.description: Indicates the reason for VRRP group state change

last-state-change-time.description: Time when state of the VRRP group last changed

adv-interval-errors.description: Total number of VRRP packets that arrived with advertisement interval different to the configured value

ip-ttl-errors.description: Total number of VRRP packets received by the virtual router with IPv4 TTL (for VRRP over IPv4) or IPv6 Hop Limit (for VRRP over IPv6) not equal to 255

rcvd-pri-zero-pak.description: Total number of VRRP packets received with priority 0

sent-pri-zero-pak.description: Total number of VRRP packets sent with priority 0

rcvd-invalid-type-pak.description: Total number of VRRP packets received with invalid Type field

addr-list-errors.description: Total number of VRRP packets received with address not matching the address list locally configured on the router

pak-len-errors.description: Total number of VRRP packets received with length less that VRRP header length

discontinuity-time.description: Indicates the last time when a discontinuity happened in gathering statistics

advertisement-sent.description: Total number of VRRP packets sent

advertisement-rcvd.description: Total number of VRRP packets received

omp-state.description: Indicates the state of the Overlay Management protocol tracking

bfd-enabled.description: BFD peer is enabled for the group

bfd-state.description: BFD session state for the configured peer IP

state-change-reason.description: Indicates why the state of the VRRP group has changed

items.description: Contains the list of secondary address configured on the group
